data.title: The Texas Musicians Museum is in Irving, TX (not Waxahachie) and it's awesome!
data.text:
The Texas Musician's Museum is in Irving, right downtown at 222 Irving Blvd. In fact, it's just across the street from the TRE, so you can take the train from anywhere in the DFW metroplex and walk across the street and you're there!
I've been to two events, they have live music every weekend. I totally enjoyed both evenings. Tio Carlos caters great Mexican food, and they have a bar at the museum as well. Once the weather stays a little warmer, they will have music events outdoors. They have a beautiful garden with a huge, covered stage and it's even available for rental for private parties. The two times I went, there wasn't a cover, but merely a request for a donation for the band. I NEVER have cash, so don't forget that when you go, you'll want to drop something in the bucket. The bar and cafe, memorabilia for sale and entry to the exhibits can be put on a debit or credit card, so that helps.
The gallery exhibits are awesome. It's hard to believe how many incredible musicians are from our great State! There are concert posters, original costumes, signed guitars, articles, letters and photos galore!
If you want to make sure you have a table, call ahead and let them know how many and they'll be happy to take care of you.

data.title: This has moved to Irving, TX.
data.text: If you get a chance go see this place. Really enjoyed the exhibits on Texas Musicians. It was in Waxahachie, but has moved to Irving and they have done a bang up job with it.

data.title: Wow, where did he get all this stuff?
data.text: We had a great time visiting the Texas Musicians Museum on our visit to downtown Waxahachie. Unique items that you wouldn't expect to see. From old school blues, country and even rock. Very educational. It is also located in an old historic hotel which even adds to the charm.
